etymology.description: The name reflects Azerbaijan's status as a Socialist Soviet Republic within the USSR, emphasizing its governance and ideological alignment with Soviet socialism.

government.1920_1990: Unitary Marxist-Leninist single-party Soviet socialist republic

military.description: While specific details on the Azerbaijani SSR's military forces are not provided, it was part of the Soviet military structure. The USSR's military resources were centralized, and republics like Azerbaijan would have had local military districts or units that were integrated into the larger Soviet military framework.

notes.transcaucasianSFSRIntegration: Azerbaijan, along with the Armenian SSR and Georgian SSR, was incorporated into the Transcaucasian SFSR, becoming part of the Soviet Union in December 1922.
notes.constitutionChanges: The Constitution of Azerbaijan SSR, approved on 14 March 1937, was in effect until the adoption of the new Constitution of Azerbaijan in 1995.

references.description: This JSON schema is based on historical data available up to the point of the dissolution of the Soviet Union and the subsequent independence of the Republic of Azerbaijan.
